title: [Large-Scale] Student Attention Training During Experiments: Mathematical Observation Pedagogy Based on Eye-Tracking Feedback

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts (statistics, graph interpretation) and experimental observation experience
context.additional_context: Statistical Analysis of Real-Time Eye-Tracking Data and Viewing of Math Experiment Videos in a Digital Lab Environment. Application of Mathematical Modeling to Optimize Learners' Observation Patterns

learning_goals: Learners can analyze their attention patterns with 80% accuracy using eye-tracking technology and mathematical analysis methods while watching experimental videos.
Learners can reduce relevant information search time by over 30% during experimental observations based on feedback data and probabilistic modeling.
Learners can graph eye-tracking results, identify distraction factors through statistical analysis, and propose at least three improvement strategies.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
